Class Fluents

Implements propositions and predicates that vary with time.

Methods

Fluent(String, Problem, Boolean, Boolean)

Makes a fluent, i.e. a time-varying proposition.

Declaration
public static Func<int, Fluents.FluentInstantiation> Fluent(string name, Problem problem = null, bool requireActivationSupport = true, bool requireDeactivationSupport = true)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String name

Name of the fluent
Problem problem

Problem to add it to
System.Boolean requireActivationSupport

If true, only activate the fluent when the activation is supported by a Rule
System.Boolean requireDeactivationSupport

If true, only deactivate the fluent when the deactivation is suppered by a Rule.
Returns
Type Description
System.Func<System.Int32, Fluents.FluentInstantiation>

The new fluent

Creates a fluent predicate, with two arguments besides the timepoint, over the specified domain
